sections.heading: DIR-3 KYC Filing: Online Compliance for Directors in India
content: File DIR-3 KYC online to keep your DIN active and avoid a ₹5,000 penalty and DIN deactivation.

sections.heading: What is DIR-3 KYC?
content: DIR-3 KYC (Director KYC) is an annual MCA requirement that verifies and updates:

sections.heading: Purpose
content: It ensures your DIN remains active for company filings.

sections.heading: Who Needs to File DIR-3 KYC?

points: All directors holding a DIN as of March 31st
Directors of Private Limited, OPC, LLP, and Public Companies

sections.heading: Important Note
content: Everyone with a DIN must file DIR-3 KYC annually.

points: Late filing results in automatic DIN deactivation
Cannot sign or file ROC forms

sections.heading: Note
content: The penalty is fixed and non-negotiable if you miss the deadline.

points: For directors with no changes in information
When phone number, email, or address has changed

list.title: Is DIR-3 KYC mandatory every year?
points: Yes. Annual filing is required to keep your DIN active.

list.title: What happens if I miss the DIR-3 KYC deadline?
points: Your DIN will be deactivated, and you'll need to pay ₹5,000 to reactivate it.

list.title: Can I file DIR-3 KYC myself?
points: Yes, but errors can lead to rejection or deactivation. Professional filing is recommended to ensure accuracy.

list.title: Do I need to file DIR-3 KYC if I'm no longer a director?
points: Yes. As long as your DIN is active, you must file DIR-3 KYC annually.
